page.title: 08WILD LIFE
page.content: The main area studied was the shore of the Eden estuary.Here the mud flats exposed at low tide are a prime source of food for many migrants and local wading birds.The population, both types and numbers, varies with the seasons and when we visited the area it was a quiet time. Even so there were numbers of Eider duck, who occasionally nest here; pairs of Shelduck ready to move off into the country side to nest a pair of mute swans who are the local residents; and flocks of Dunlin feeding on the mud flats. Herons are frequently seen fishing at the mouth of the estuary. Rabbits and hares were also spotted.
